parameters.label: <parameter's name/description (string)>
parameters.functionName: <name of the function that will be used to retrieve the parameter from the module instance, should have no inputs and only one output (string)>
parameters.displayType: <parameter's type of content, for display purpose (string)>

type.eligibility: <whether the module is an eligiblity module (boolean)>
type.toggle: <whether the module is a toggle module (boolean)>
type.hatter: <whether the module is a hatter module (boolean)>

tags.description: Indicates that the module is now deprecated
tags.label: Deprecated

creationArgs.useHatId: <Whether the modules's hatId property (provide to the factory's creation function) should be set with the ID of the hat for which the module is deployed (boolean)>

immutable.name: <argument's name (string)>
immutable.example: <example argument which will be used for automatic testing>
immutable.displayType: <parameter's type of content, for display purpose>
immutable.optional: <optional field, setting to 'true' indicates that this input is optional>

mutable.name: <argument's name (string)>
mutable.example: <example argument, will be used for automated deployment tests>
mutable.displayType: <parameter's type of content, for display purpose>
mutable.optional: <optional field, setting to 'true' indicates that this input is optional>

customRoles.name: <role's name (string)>
customRoles.criteria: <name of the module function that is used to retrieve the role's owner (string)>
customRoles.hatAdminsFallback: <optional field, if 'true' then indicates that the role has a fallback to Hat's admin roles in case the criteria function returns a zero value>

roles: <ID of a role which has the authority to call this function (string)>
writeFunctions.label: <Human readable name for the function, for display purpose (string)>
writeFunctions.primary: <optional field, indicates that this is the role's primary function, for display purpose (boolean)>

args.name: <argument's human readable name, for display purpose (string)>
args.displayType: <arguments's type of content, for display purpose>
args.optional: <optional field, setting to 'true' indicates that this input is optional>
